com.optimizely.ab.android.shared

Class ServiceScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.optimizely.ab.android.shared.ServiceScheduler

  • public class ServiceScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    Schedules Servicees to run.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ServiceScheduler.PendingIntentFactory
      Handles the complexities around PendingIntent flags We need to know if the PendingIntent has already been created to prevent pushing the alarm back after the last event.

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public void schedule(android.content.Intent intent,
                     long interval)
        Schedule a service starting Intent that starts on an interval Previously scheduled services matching this intent will be unscheduled. They will match even if the interval is different. For API 26 and higher, the JobScheduler is used. APIs below 26 still use the AlarmService
        Parameters:
        intent - an Intent
        interval - the interval in MS

      • unschedule

        public void unschedule(android.content.Intent intent)
        Unschedule a scheduled Intent The Intent must equal the intent that was originally sent to schedule(Intent, long)
        Parameters:
        intent - an service starting Intent instance

      • isScheduled

        public boolean isScheduled(android.content.Intent intent)
        Is an Intent for a service scheduled
        Parameters:
        intent - the intent in question
        Returns:
        is it scheduled or not

      • startService

        public static void startService(android.content.Context context,
                                java.lang.Integer jobId,
                                android.content.Intent intent)
        Start a service either through the context or enqueued to the JobService to be run in a minute. For example, the BroadcastReceivers use this to handle all versions of the API.
        Parameters:
        context - - Application context
        jobId - - job id for the job to start if it is a job
        intent - - Intent you want to run.
